intro: Encholirium corallinum, commonly known as the coral lily, is a striking plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Alstroemeriaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, coral-colored flowers. The plant produces large, showy inflorescences that can reach up to 3 meters in height, making it a notable ornamental species. Its flowers are typically borne in clusters and are pollinated by birds, particularly hummingbirds. Encholirium corallinum thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests at elevations above 2,500 meters.
